News.Title: HT Media Seeks Shareholder Approval for New MD & CEO
News.Summary: HT Media Limited has issued a postal ballot notice seeking shareholder approval for the appointment of Sameer Singh as Managing Director & CEO with a remuneration package of up to Rs. 412 lakhs per annum.

News.Title: HT Media Board Meet on Jan 28 for Q3FY26 Results
News.Summary: HT Media Limited has scheduled its board meeting for January 28, 2026, to consider and approve Q3FY26 unaudited financial results. Trading window remains closed until January 30, 2026.

News.Title: HT Media Puts FM Radio Station Closure on Hold
News.Summary: HT Media Limited has decided to keep the closure of its Fever FM Radio Station in Chennai on hold, reversing its earlier decision to shut operations from December 24, 2025.

News.Title: HT Media Unit to Surrender Fever FM License in Chennai
News.Summary: HT Media's subsidiary will relinquish its broadcasting license for the Fever FM radio station operating in Chennai. This decision affects the company's radio broadcasting operations and presence in the Chennai market.

News.Title: HT Media Reports 4% Revenue Growth and Improved Margins in Q2 Results
News.Summary: HT Media Limited reported consolidated revenue of ₹499 crore for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, marking a 4% year-on-year growth and 11% sequential increase. EBITDA improved significantly to ₹44 crore from ₹33 crore in the same quarter last year, with margins expanding to 9% from 7%. The company reduced losses with PAT improving to -₹4 crore from -₹6 crore year-on-year. Print business drove growth with operating revenue rising 7% annually to ₹358 crore, led by 10% growth in advertising revenue to ₹278 crore. Print operating margins expanded substantially to 11% from 6%. Digital segment revenue grew 10% to ₹61 crore but margins remained pressured at -49%. Radio business showed sequential improvement with 4% quarterly revenue growth to ₹32 crore, though annual revenue declined 8%. The company maintained a strong cash position of ₹947 crore.

News.Title: HT Media Reports 23% Digital Revenue Growth, Guides for Gradual Recovery in Print and Radio
News.Summary: HT Media reported digital revenue growth of 23% year-over-year, with digital now accounting for 31% of total sales. The company provided guidance for gradual recovery in its print advertising and radio segments. HT Media is expanding its subscription model through OTT platforms and news portals while implementing strategic cost rationalization measures to restore margins. The company is focusing on digital transformation, brand monetization, and regional content expansion as part of its long-term growth strategy.

News.Title: HT Media Reports Narrower Quarterly Loss and Revenue Growth
News.Summary: HT Media reported a consolidated net loss of 40.3 million rupees in its quarterly results, which represents an improvement from the loss of 75.8 million rupees in the same period last year. The company's revenue increased to 4.51 billion rupees compared to 4.24 billion rupees year-over-year.

News.Title: HT Media Reports 6% Revenue Growth to INR 451 Cr in Q1 FY26, Print Business Drives Performance
News.Summary: HT Media Group reported total revenues of INR 451 crores for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, representing 6% year-on-year growth. The company posted a net loss of INR 11 crores, showing 59% improvement compared to the previous year. Print business led the performance with operating revenues of INR 324 crores (8% growth) driven by strong advertising revenue growth of 17% to INR 255 crores. English segment advertising revenue grew 19% to INR 140 crores, while Hindi segment grew 14% to INR 116 crores. Education, Real Estate, and BFSI sectors contributed significantly to advertising growth, with government revenue normalizing after election-related restrictions in the previous year. Digital business revenues increased 21% to INR 56 crores, with platforms like OTTplay showing growth. Radio segment faced pressure with revenues declining to INR 31 crores from INR 36 crores. The company maintains a healthy net cash position of INR 976 crores. Management continues strategic investments in circulation growth through selective pricing discounts and is focusing on expanding digital offerings while addressing Radio business challenges.

News.Title: HT Media Reports Q1 FY2026 Loss, Approves Rs 15 Crore Investment in Subsidiary
News.Summary: HT Media Limited's Board approved quarterly results for Q1 FY2026 showing consolidated net loss of Rs 1,333 lakhs compared to Rs 2,550 lakhs loss in the same quarter last year. Revenue from operations increased to Rs 41,215 lakhs from Rs 37,851 lakhs year-on-year. The company's printing & publishing segment generated Rs 32,388 lakhs revenue while radio broadcast & entertainment contributed Rs 3,100 lakhs and digital segment Rs 5,648 lakhs. The Board also authorized investment of up to Rs 15 crore in wholly-owned subsidiary Mosaic Media Ventures Private Limited through equity share subscription. Mosaic Media, incorporated in 2007, operates in news gathering, analysis and research business with turnover of Rs 27.11 crore in FY25. The investment will be completed within 12 months through cash consideration in tranches.

News.Title: HT Media: Q4 Profit Soars, Stock Surges 20%
News.Summary: HT Media reported Q4 net profit of ₹41 crore, up from ₹1.2 crore last year. Revenue increased 10.6% to ₹513.6 crore. EBITDA rose to ₹25.6 crore with margins improving to 4.98%. Manhar Kapoor appointed as Whole-time Director for three years from May 20, 2025. Stock surged 20% following the announcement.

News.Title: HT Media Reports Improved Q4 Financial Results
News.Summary: HT Media has announced its Q4 financial results. The company's EBITDA increased to 1 billion rupees from 642 million rupees year-over-year. The EBITDA margin improved to 19.49% from 13.82% in the same period last year. Revenue rose to 5.1 billion rupees from 4.6 billion rupees year-over-year. Consolidated net profit significantly increased to 410 million rupees from 13 million rupees in the previous year's corresponding quarter.

News.Title: HT Media Approves Conversion of Loans to Equity in Next Radio
News.Summary: HT Media has approved the conversion of outstanding loans amounting to 2.12 billion rupees into equity shares for Next Radio. This conversion will result in the issuance of 212 million equity shares in Next Radio.

News.Title: HT Media Reports Reduced Q3 Consolidated Net Loss
News.Summary: HT Media Limited reported a consolidated net loss of 60 million rupees for the third quarter, showing an improvement from the 131 million rupee loss in the same period last year.

News.Title: HT Media Receives NCLT Approval for Amalgamation with HT Mobile Solutions
News.Summary: HT Media Limited has announced that the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has approved the scheme of amalgamation between HT Mobile Solutions and HT Media. This corporate action represents a significant step in the company's restructuring efforts.

News.Title: HT Media Reports Reduced Q2 Loss and Revenue Growth
News.Summary: HT Media's Q2 consolidated net loss narrowed to 76 million rupees from 503 million rupees in the same period last year. The company's revenue increased to 4.24 billion rupees from 3.93 billion rupees year-over-year.
